alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 8:20PM CDT until March 22 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .Snowmelt runoff is making its way into the Snake River. Reaches its initial peak after the night of March 19th. For the Snake River...including Warren, Alvarado...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 65.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 69.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
